member.name: P:Amazon.MediaPackageVod.Model.CmafPackage.IncludeEncoderConfigurationInSegments
member.summary: Gets and sets the property IncludeEncoderConfigurationInSegments. When includeEncoderConfigurationInSegments is set to true, MediaPackage places your encoder's Sequence Parameter Set (SPS), Picture Parameter Set (PPS), and Video Parameter Set (VPS) metadata in every video segment instead of in the init fragment. This lets you use different SPS/PPS/VPS settings for your assets during content playback.

member.summary: Gets and sets the property SegmentDurationSeconds. Duration (in seconds) of each fragment. Actual fragments will berounded to the nearest multiple of the source fragment duration.

member.summary: Gets and sets the property SpekeKeyProvider.

member.name: T:Amazon.MediaPackageVod.Model.DashManifest
member.summary: A DASH manifest configuration.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaPackageVod.Model.DashManifest.ManifestLayout
member.summary: Gets and sets the property ManifestLayout. Determines the position of some tags in the Media Presentation Description (MPD). When set to FULL, elements like SegmentTemplate and ContentProtection are included in each Representation. When set to COMPACT, duplicate elements are combined and presented at the AdaptationSet level.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaPackageVod.Model.DashManifest.ManifestName
member.summary: Gets and sets the property ManifestName. An optional string to include in the name of the manifest.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaPackageVod.Model.DashManifest.MinBufferTimeSeconds
member.summary: Gets and sets the property MinBufferTimeSeconds. Minimum duration (in seconds) that a player will buffer media before starting the presentation.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaPackageVod.Model.DashManifest.Profile
member.summary: Gets and sets the property Profile. The Dynamic Adaptive Streaming over HTTP (DASH) profile type. When set to "HBBTV_1_5", HbbTV 1.5 compliant output is enabled.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaPackageVod.Model.DashManifest.StreamSelection
member.summary: Gets and sets the property StreamSelection.

member.name: T:Amazon.MediaPackageVod.Model.DashPackage
member.summary: A Dynamic Adaptive Streaming over HTTP (DASH) packaging configuration.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaPackageVod.Model.DashPackage.DashManifests
member.summary: Gets and sets the property DashManifests. A list of DASH manifest configurations.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaPackageVod.Model.DashPackage.Encryption
member.summary: Gets and sets the property Encryption.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaPackageVod.Model.DashPackage.IncludeEncoderConfigurationInSegments
member.summary: Gets and sets the property IncludeEncoderConfigurationInSegments. When includeEncoderConfigurationInSegments is set to true, MediaPackage places your encoder's Sequence Parameter Set (SPS), Picture Parameter Set (PPS), and Video Parameter Set (VPS) metadata in every video segment instead of in the init fragment. This lets you use different SPS/PPS/VPS settings for your assets during content playback.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaPackageVod.Model.DashPackage.PeriodTriggers
member.summary: Gets and sets the property PeriodTriggers. A list of triggers that controls when the outgoing Dynamic Adaptive Streaming over HTTP (DASH)Media Presentation Description (MPD) will be partitioned into multiple periods. If empty, the content will notbe partitioned into more than one period. If the list contains "ADS", new periods will be created wherethe Asset contains SCTE-35 ad markers.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaPackageVod.Model.DashPackage.SegmentDurationSeconds
member.summary: Gets and sets the property SegmentDurationSeconds. Duration (in seconds) of each segment. Actual segments will berounded to the nearest multiple of the source segment duration.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaPackageVod.Model.DashPackage.SegmentTemplateFormat
member.summary: Gets and sets the property SegmentTemplateFormat. Determines the type of SegmentTemplate included in the Media Presentation Description (MPD). When set to NUMBER_WITH_TIMELINE, a full timeline is presented in each SegmentTemplate, with $Number$ media URLs. When set to TIME_WITH_TIMELINE, a full timeline is presented in each SegmentTemplate, with $Time$ media URLs. When set to NUMBER_WITH_DURATION, only a duration is included in each SegmentTemplate, with $Number$ media URLs.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaPackageVod.Model.HlsEncryption.EncryptionMethod
member.summary: Gets and sets the property EncryptionMethod. The encryption method to use.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaPackageVod.Model.HlsEncryption.SpekeKeyProvider
member.summary: Gets and sets the property SpekeKeyProvider.

member.name: T:Amazon.MediaPackageVod.Model.HlsManifest
member.summary: An HTTP Live Streaming (HLS) manifest configuration.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaPackageVod.Model.HlsManifest.AdMarkers
member.summary: Gets and sets the property AdMarkers. This setting controls how ad markers are included in the packaged OriginEndpoint."NONE" will omit all SCTE-35 ad markers from the output."PASSTHROUGH" causes the manifest to contain a copy of the SCTE-35 admarkers (comments) taken directly from the input HTTP Live Streaming (HLS) manifest."SCTE35_ENHANCED" generates ad markers and blackout tags based on SCTE-35messages in the input source.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaPackageVod.Model.HlsManifest.IncludeIframeOnlyStream
member.summary: Gets and sets the property IncludeIframeOnlyStream. When enabled, an I-Frame only stream will be included in the output.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaPackageVod.Model.HlsManifest.ManifestName
member.summary: Gets and sets the property ManifestName. An optional string to include in the name of the manifest.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaPackageVod.Model.HlsManifest.ProgramDateTimeIntervalSeconds
member.summary: Gets and sets the property ProgramDateTimeIntervalSeconds. The interval (in seconds) between each EXT-X-PROGRAM-DATE-TIME taginserted into manifests. Additionally, when an interval is specifiedID3Timed Metadata messages will be generated every 5 seconds using theingest time of the content.If the interval is not specified, or set to 0, thenno EXT-X-PROGRAM-DATE-TIME tags will be inserted into manifests and noID3Timed Metadata messages will be generated. Note that irrespectiveof this parameter, if any ID3 Timed Metadata is found in HTTP Live Streaming (HLS) input,it will be passed through to HLS output.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaPackageVod.Model.HlsManifest.RepeatExtXKey
member.summary: Gets and sets the property RepeatExtXKey. When enabled, the EXT-X-KEY tag will be repeated in output manifests.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaPackageVod.Model.HlsManifest.StreamSelection
member.summary: Gets and sets the property StreamSelection.

member.name: T:Amazon.MediaPackageVod.Model.HlsPackage
member.summary: An HTTP Live Streaming (HLS) packaging configuration.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaPackageVod.Model.HlsPackage.Encryption
member.summary: Gets and sets the property Encryption.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaPackageVod.Model.HlsPackage.HlsManifests
member.summary: Gets and sets the property HlsManifests. A list of HLS manifest configurations.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaPackageVod.Model.HlsPackage.IncludeDvbSubtitles
member.summary: Gets and sets the property IncludeDvbSubtitles. When enabled, MediaPackage passes through digital video broadcasting (DVB) subtitles into the output.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaPackageVod.Model.HlsPackage.SegmentDurationSeconds
member.summary: Gets and sets the property SegmentDurationSeconds. Duration (in seconds) of each fragment. Actual fragments will berounded to the nearest multiple of the source fragment duration.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaPackageVod.Model.HlsPackage.UseAudioRenditionGroup
member.summary: Gets and sets the property UseAudioRenditionGroup. When enabled, audio streams will be placed in rendition groups in the output.

member.name: M:Amazon.MediaPackageVod.AmazonMediaPackageVodClient.#ctor
member.summary:
Constructs AmazonMediaPackageVodClient with the credentials loaded from the application's default configuration, and if unsuccessful from the Instance Profile service on an EC2 instance.
Example App.config with credentials set.
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8" ?> <configuration> <appSettings> <add key="AWSProfileName" value="AWS Default"/> </appSettings> </configuration>
